interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Frankenweenie
Review Date: 2013/03/01
Store: Martin Short  (Actor),     Catherine O'Hara  (Actor),     Tim Burton  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment, All Disney Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'From Disney and creative genius Tim Burton (ALICE IN WONDERLAND; THE NIGHTMARE BEFORE CHRISTMAS) comes the hilarious and offbeat FRANKENWEENIE, a heartwarming tale about a boy and his dog. After unexpectedly losing his beloved dog Sparky, young Victor harnesses the power of science to bring his best friend back to life -- with just a few minor adjustments. He tries to hide his home-sewn creation, but when Sparky gets out, Victor\'s fellow students, teachers and the entire town learn that getting a new "leash on life" can be monstrous. Complete with electrifying bonus features, FRANKENWEENIE is alive with enchanting fun for the whole family.', 'Brand Story', 'By']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Animation', 'Format': 'AC-3, Animated, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen, Dubbed, Enhanced', 'Contributor': "Charlie Tahan, Robert Capron, Martin Short, Tim Burton, Martin Landau, Atticus Shaffer, Catherine O'Hara, Winona RyderCharlie Tahan, Robert Capron, Martin Short, Tim Burton, Martin Landau, Atticus Shaffer, Catherine O'Hara, Winona Ryder  See more", 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 27 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MFR786936814149#VG', 'Director': 'Tim Burton', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Animated, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen, Dubbed, Enhanced', 'Run time': '1 hour and 27 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 8, 2013', 'Actors': "Martin Short, Catherine O'Hara, Martin Landau, Winona Ryder, Robert Capron", 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish, English', 'Studio': 'WALT DISNEY PICTURES', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: If you do not "get" Tim Burton, this movie may not thrill you, but the art is incredible. You have to consider the pain-stacking stop-motion work despite the odd story-line. This is art at its best. I was only sad that he didn't work with Johny Depp on this one.
Review Title: You have to love Tim Burton!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

['Product Description', 'From Disney and creative genius Tim Burton (ALICE IN WONDERLAND; THE NIGHTMARE BEFORE CHRISTMAS) comes the hilarious and offbeat FRANKENWEENIE, a heartwarming tale about a boy and his dog. After unexpectedly losing his beloved dog Sparky, young Victor harnesses the power of science to bring his best friend back to life -- with just a few minor adjustments. He tries to hide his home-sewn creation, but when Sparky gets out, Victor\'s fellow students, teachers and the entire town learn that getting a new "leash on life" can be monstrous. Complete with electrifying bonus features, FRANKENWEENIE is alive with enchanting fun for the whole family.', 'Brand Story', 'By']
{'Genre': 'Animation', 'Format': 'AC-3, Animated, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen, Dubbed, Enhanced', 'Contributor': "Charlie Tahan, Robert Capron, Martin Short, Tim Burton, Martin Landau, Atticus Shaffer, Catherine O'Hara, Winona RyderCharlie Tahan, Robert Capron, Martin Short, Tim Burton, Martin Landau, Atticus Shaffer, Catherine O'Hara, Winona Ryder  See more", 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 27 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MFR786936814149#VG', 'Director': 'Tim Burton', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Animated, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen, Dubbed, Enhanced', 'Run time': '1 hour and 27 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 8, 2013', 'Actors': "Martin Short, Catherine O'Hara, Martin Landau, Winona Ryder, Robert Capron", 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish, English', 'Studio': 'WALT DISNEY PICTURES', 'Number of discs': '1'}
If you do not "get" Tim Burton, this movie may not thrill you, but the art is incredible. You have to consider the pain-stacking stop-motion work despite the odd story-line. This is art at its best. I was only sad that he didn't work with Johny Depp on this one.
You have to love Tim Burton!
profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Favorite Genre**: Animation, with a preference for unique and offbeat storytelling, particularly in the realm of family-friendly content.
  
- **Preferred Directors**: Strong admiration for Tim Burton, indicating an appreciation for his distinctive artistic style and storytelling approach.

- **Artistic Appreciation**: High regard for animation as an art form, specifically valuing the intricacies of stop-motion techniques and visual aesthetics.

- **Emotional Depth**: Interest in narratives that blend heartwarming themes with unusual or darker elements.

- **Review Engagement**: Willingness to provide detailed feedback on media consumption, highlighting both artistic merit and personal sentiments regarding creative choices.

- **Value in Collaborations**: Notable interest in collaborative works among notable actors and directors, expressing specific preferences for collaborations seen in previous projects.

Overall, this user is drawn to imaginative animations that offer a unique storytelling experience, particularly those created by Tim Burton, reflecting their appreciation for both the craft of animation and the subtleties of artistic expression.
